story_prompt: Your Significant Other has landed a book publishing deal! You're very proud of them, even if you don't actually enjoy their writing. One day, on a whim, you buy an actual copy in a book store. It's nothing like the pages they gave you to read. Nothing.
output:
How do you respond when they find out?

(Please use proper grammar and spelling, as if this were a professional submission)

Dear Writer,

I'm thrilled to hear about your publishing deal! It's a dream come true, and I'm so proud of you for pursuing your passion. I've always been a fan of your work, even if I don't necessarily enjoy every aspect of it. But that's the beauty of art - it's subjective, and what speaks to one person might not resonate with another.

When I heard the news, I couldn't wait to get my hands on a copy of your book. I wanted to hold it in my hands, feel the weight of your words, and flip through the pages. So, on a whim, I stopped by a bookstore and picked up a copy.

As I started reading, I was taken aback. The words on those pages were not the ones I had read before. The style was different, the tone was different, and the story itself was unfamiliar. I felt like I had been transported to a different world, one that was foreign and unexpected.

At first, I was confused. I thought to myself, "Is this really the same person who wrote those beautiful, heart-wrenching stories I've read before?" But as I continued to read, something unexpected happened. I found myself getting lost in the narrative, drawn into the world you had created. The characters came alive, their struggles and triumphs becoming my own. I laughed, I cried, and I felt everything in between.

It was then that I realized that your talent goes beyond just writing. You have a gift for storytelling, for weaving together words that create a tapestry of emotions and experiences. Your writing touches people's hearts, makes them think, and challenges their perspectives. And that, my dear, is truly special.

So, how do I respond when you find out that I bought a copy of your book? With honesty, of course. I'll tell you how much I admire your work, how proud I am of your accomplishments, and how grateful I am to be able to share in this journey with you.

I know that not everyone will appreciate your writing in the same way that I do. But that's okay. Art is subjective, and what matters most is that your work speaks to those who need it. You have a gift, my love, and I'm so lucky to be able to witness it firsthand.

With all my love and support,

[Your Name]
